%text Sometimes, knowing the exact value of an expression is not as important as knowing what the value might be like $\left( <0, > 5\right)$ etc Just having a sense of the value can guide the logic of what you do next For example, you might need to determine whether $\sin \left(\frac\pi{2} - \frac{3}{2} \right) > 0$ or $< 0$ in order to solve a problem You would need to get a little creative % \begin{align}
\pi \approx 3&\text{ but } \pi > 3 \\ \text{And so, }\left(\frac{\pi-3}{2} \right) &= \frac\pi{2} - \frac{3}{2} > 0 \\ \text{Also } \left(\frac\pi{2}-\frac{3}{2} \right) &\to 0 \\ \text{Hence, } \sin \left(\frac\pi{2}-\frac{3}{2} \right) &> 0 \end{align} %text %
